creator: apache-bugzilla@deuxchevaux.org
text:
apachectl status tries to fetch http://localhost/server-status even if the
apache is configured for listening on some other port then port 80.

Example:

httpd.conf contains: Listen 8002

apachectl status says:

> /opt/apache2/bin/apachectl status

Looking up localhost
localhost
Making HTTP connection to localhost
Alert!: Unable to connect to remote host.

lynx: Can't access startfile http://localhost/server-status
>

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
apachectl is just a simple shell-script.  It is not meant to work out-of-the-box
for every single configuration.  You should just open up apachectl in an
editor and tell it the correct URL to request.

Thanks for using Apache.
